data.title: Wedding party and out of town guests stayed
data.text:
We were in for a family wedding. Bridal party, family and friends stayed with a block of rooms.  Lounge / bar area very nice.  Offered reception time from 5:30-7:30 pm with drink tickets.  Breakfast was provided with our stay.  We had a bedroom suite which was sized well for our family of 6.  Separate living area from bedroom with 2 double beds.  

Hotel provided shuttles to the wedding reception but we took our own car.  Big hotel but it didn't feel like it when we came and went to events.  Nicely located off I-75.  Central to the church and wedding reception.  

Only suggestion to hotel is to place garbage cans in lobby or outside area.

data.title: Exceptional stay
data.text: We stayed here for a wedding.  The service was excellent.  We had no problems.  None of our friends/family had any problems either.  The kids all used the pool/hot tub and were happy with that.  The breakfast was good also.

data.title: "A Year-Round Suburban, Getaway Sanctuary!"
data.text: Trendy, Complementary Furnishings, throughout a well-appointed 2-Room Suite; with microwave & mini-fridge!  Greeted by friendly, professional staff, some which are long-term  employees; like:  "Patti in the Breakfast area, Golam, who handles Bar Area &  Daily, Managers' Reception; and, Sheryl who has been pleasant &  most helpful, upon our initial Check-In!  The Indoor Amenities, include Omelets to order plus a Great, Hot & Cold Breakfast Buffet! Indoor Pool, Whirlpool, Fitness Center & Business Center; and Free Wi-Fi are added bonuses!

data.title: Weekend getaway
data.text: Great hotel with plenty of amenities. The atrium area is beautiful and was a great place to sit and relax. The complimentary reception was a great touch. The pool area was great until a group of kids came in and overtook the entire pool. They were really inconsiderate and the parent paid no attention to their screaming, diving and splashing. Breakfast buffet offered more than what you can even try!

data.title: Peaceful stay
data.text: This was an excellent choice. Friendly front desk and restaurant staff. Upon arrival we were greeted with goody bags. We had complimentary drinks each day of our stay. Complimentary hot breakfast, evening reception each day. Rooms were clean n fresh. We will definitely be back when in the area.

data.title: Repeat stay when in the Detroit area!
data.text: A great place to stay when you are in town for a state marching band competition! Value of the room great compared to staying in downtown area.  Easy access from Interstate 75.  Able to get into our room hours earlier, knowing we wouldn't be back until after midnight. Friendly staff throughout.  Congested breakfast line area but always great food choices. Second time staying there and I would be back if in the area.

data.title: 6 yrs now
data.text: My wife and I love it here. We've been coming here since before we were married. Golam always takes great care of us at the manager's reception. Amazing that he never forgets us - in fact he smiles when he sees us on a Friday night. Breakfast is always beyond expectations.

data.text:
Staff is friendly, welcomng and attentive. Food and service are very
good. We especially enjoy the cooked to order beeakfast. I have food allergies and  Chef Calvin goes above and beyond to be accomodating.

data.title: Disappointment
data.text: I recently got married at MSU's MEC and they work with Embassy for room blocks and transportation. We had booked 11 rooms Friday night and 41 rooms Saturday night. The staff at Embassy Suites in Troy cannot handle that kind of occupancy. They messed up several of our guests rooms (which were booked at least a month in advance), the front desk staff wasn't very accommodating or friendly, one lady was flat out rude and questioned my MOH on how many girls were actually staying in the bridal suite and didn't want to give her a room key. My husband was billed over $600 for 3 rooms, he called and was forwarded to the billing department, they never answered the phone, so he left a voicemail and a week had gone by and no one returned his call. He called again, asked to be forwarded to someone who would actually answer the phone. He eventually spoke with Evette who was friendly and helpful but even at that it took 3 days to get his money refunded. The rooms, breakfast and cocktail hour were all fine, nothing to complain or rave about. I just expected better, more professional and accommodating service in general from an Embassy hotel but especially since we had such a large party staying there. Overall the whole experience was frustrating and I really regret having taken our business there.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Embassy Suites by Hilton Detroit - Troy/Auburn Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Morgan C,
Thank you for the review and for your feedback about our property. I will definitely review your feedback with our management team. Just wanted to make you aware that we are going to renovate the rooms soon! Thanks again for the review and your valued business.
Evette,
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A real shame
data.text: We have always liked Embassy Suites unfortunately there was a children's hockey tournament going on. NO Chaperones watching the kids, dropping objects off the baloney area. Using the hockey puck and sticks by the elevator on the fourth floor. First time I've given a poor review.  Manager's should have stopped the children and had the chaperones come and claim the children.  Screaming,  running around and dropping things off the baloney are good reason to stop children and hold them till an adult comes to claim them.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: Room was a bit outdated but lobby was super nice. Nice bar area. Breakfast was included which made things easier. Receptionist wasn't super kind and didnt activate our keys properly. Overall not a bad hotel.

data.title: Renovation of rooms needed!
data.text:
Had a good stay-staff very helpful, there for weekend.  Unfortunately I can't say the same about room.  I had a handicapped room on 8th floor and it really showed signs of its age.  Even the hairdryer didn't work properly!  Requested new one and later that day they had put one in room-luckily I got by with it on low heat when getting dressed that morning.  Highlight was breakfast-chef making omelettes was very good and friendly.
I have stayed at Embassy suites all around the country and I think this one needs to "freshen up" its rooms.   Oh yeah one of 3 elevators was down all weekend.

data.title: It's Embassy Suites !!!
data.text: The title says it all "It's Embassy Suites" I had a great time there from the Manager's Reception at night to the free cooked to order breakfast in the morning. The rooms are big and clean and most important quiet. While enjoying the Managers Reception I overheard on a large group was having their 50th High School reunion at the hotel and the hospitality suite was located directly above me on the next floor. I went back to my room and never heard a thing until later when I went down to the Pool and Jacuzzi, I could hear their party throughout the atrium but once back in my room quiet peaceful bliss. Definitely a hotel worth staying at!

data.title: nice visit...but slowly showing its age
data.text:
We have been to this hotel multiple times as a family.  We stayed for two nights to go the hockey game and to just relax and do a little shopping.
Check in and check out was friendly with no issues. Bar and common area's were clean for the most part.  Elevators were dirty...never wiped down. All you saw was dirt and prints on the glass wall, ceilings, etc. Floor were never cleaned as well in this elevator....and unless you are Speedy Gonzales or the Road Runner...you better get in or out of the elevator in under a second. LOL... never seen door close that quick and abruptly.
Rooms are showing their wear and tear... hold in sofa..banged up furniture, mold spots on bathroom shower ceiling....but nothing major.
The pool area was filthy. Dirt and grime all around the pool deck.  Not once cleaned while we were there. Even under the heaters by the glass walls... was filthy.
As we stayed two nights... the second day..still no maid service at 5:10 pm. I travel for work, so do understand rooms that are being booked out for the night will be done first...but 5:10 pm and still no service...that is unacceptable.  I wound up finding a housekeeper and brought my old towels that we used as a family and asked for new ones and some toilet paper. She said she would come right away...but we declined. Perhaps they were short staffed... I noticed housekeeping cleaning rooms still at 7:00 in the evening... something you never see at any hotel.
Although we like the atrium of this hotel, I think it maybe time to find another hotel for our several visits each year to this area.

data.title: Business Trip Made Fun
data.text: This was my second stay at this property and both times were exceedingly well done. From the ease of check in with personal greetings and smiles to the cocktail reception where you feel as if you're in your local pub to breakfast with the best omelet I've ever enjoyed (and I'm an omelet aficionado) the staff is amazing. Stay here for a night or a month and you'll feel like family.
